author: Helen Coffey
title: Eurostar offers brand new ski routes
text: Eurostar tickets for the 2015/16 ski season are available from today, with three different routes giving access to a bigger range of resorts than ever before. In addition to the direct high speed service from London St Pancras to the French Alps, which stops at Moûtier, Aime La Plagne and Bourg-Saint-Maurice to provide access to resorts such as Courchevel , Méribel , Les Arcs and La Plagne , this year there are two other options available. • 10 of the best ski resorts reached by train This is the first ski season that a direct Eurostar train will run from London to Lyon; taking just over four and a half hours, the service puts passengers within easy reach of many resorts in the French Alps, such as Alpe d'Huez and Les Deux Alpes . Resorts like Tignes are easily accessed by train (Photo: Andy Parant) For those looking to travel to the Swiss Alps, Eurostar has introduced a connecting service to Geneva via Lille, with trains timed to make the connection as smooth and efficient as possible. From Geneva, a huge number of ski resorts are easily reached, including Les Arcs, La Plagne, Tignes and Val d'Isère . The journey to Geneva takes just over six hours. It may be summer outside, but booking early for next season can ensure you get the best deals on tickets. A return to the French Alps costs from £149, with fares to Geneva starting at £127 return and those to Lyon from £89 return. Travelling by rail for your ski or snowboard holiday offers a range of perks – the journeys are often beautiful, plus a generous baggage allowance is included in the price of your ticket. Eurostar allows passengers to take two suitcases, one piece of hand luggage and skis or a snowboard at no extra cost. The services run from December 19 and can be booked at eurostar.com .
